rows.text: Team Screen is not available here.

Travel from one location to another costs one unit of fuel. Fuel can be found during events or at merchants in exchange for money.

Max Fuel Capacity: [0]

The expedition needs money to replenish its stocks of fuel and equipment, as well as to hire new recruits.

Max Cash Capacity: $[0]

All weapons with the exception of Knives and Disintegrators require Ammo to reload.

Max Ammo Capacity: [0]

Supplies are consumed through the use of medkits and repairkits, as well as by throwing grenades.

Max Supplies Capacity: [0]
Are you sure you would like to dismiss [entity:name]?
This is a temporary perk that only lasts until the end of the adventure.
Some of your characters are still able to perform an action. Are you sure you'd like to finish this turn?
If you continue this loot will be irretrievable. Are you sure?
You have unsold valuables in your car storage. Are you sure you'd like to continue without selling them?
Moving will cancel the currently active Ambush. Are you sure?
Moving will cancel the currently active Warning Shots. Are you sure?
Can equip Pistols. Pistols have the special ability Double Shot, which allows firing two rapid shots in one turn on two different enemies.
Can equip Assault Rifles. Assault Rifles have the special ability Burst Fire, which allows targeting multiple adjacent tiles.
Can equip Sniper Rifles. Sniper Rifles have the special ability Ambush, which fires at any enemy moving or attacking inside the ambush area during the next turn.
Can equip Shotguns. Shotguns have the special ability Blast, which damages all enemies within a cone.
Can equip Knives. Knives have the special ability Bleed, causing the target to take additional damage in the subsequent turn.

Can equip Disintegrators. Disintegrators have the special ability Meltdown, which damages everyone in a straight line until stopped by a wall. Disintegrators have internal accumulators and therefore do not need regular ammunition.
Can equip Light Armors. Light Armors enable the special ability Sprint. Sprinting allows to cover a much larger distance than a normal move.

Can equip Medium Armors. Medium Armors enable the special ability Low Profile. When Low Profile is activated, the character receives a guaranteed evade on the next attack in the current turn or during the next enemy turn.
Can equip Heavy Armors. Heavy Armors enable the special ability Hunker Down. When active, all damage taken in the current turn and during the next enemy turn is reduced by 75%.

May use Grenades. Grenades can be thrown at a distance and cause area damage.

Throwing grenades reduces supplies by one.

May use Medkits in combat. Medkits can be used to heal and revive people when they are knocked out.

Each use of a Medkit reduces supplies by one.

May use Repairkits in combat. Repairkits can be used to restore armor.

Each use of a Repairkit reduces supplies by one.
You have not yet visited this location.
There is a trader at this location.
You may recruit a new team member at this location.
There appears to be something interesting at this location.
Travel here to finish this adventure.
This location can be revisited multiple times.
Attack a single target within the weapon's range.
Knife attack a target on a neighbouring tile.
Bleed causes melee damage and additional damage the following turn.

Reload your weapon's magazine.

Ammo Available: [0]
Move within the character's walk range. The range is determined by the character's agility.
Sprint allows you to move with an additional range bonus and does not trigger Ambushes.
When in Low Profile, this character will receive a guaranteed evade on the next attack.
When hunkered down, you take 75% less damage in the current turn and during the next enemy turn.

Burst Fire allows you to target enemies within a straight connected line. It uses 1 ammo for every target inside the target area.
Mousewheel to rotate orientation.

Burst Fire allows you to target enemies within a straight connected line. It consumes 1 x Ammo for every target inside the target area. 
Use the left and right directional buttons to rotate the line of fire.
A powerful blast damaging targets in a conical shape in front of you. It uses 2 ammo. Blast damage is reduced by 20%.
A meltdown damages all units in a straight line until it hits an obstacle. Each successive unit shot reduces the remaining damage by 40%.

Ambush lets you place a conical area to observe. The first enemy trying to move or attack in this area will be interrupted and trigger a counter attack from your character. 

If your character takes damage, their ambush status will be cancelled.
Attacks two different targets in rapid succession. A Double Shot uses 2 ammo.

Use Medkit on target to heal or revive people when they are knocked out.

Each use of a Medkit reduces supplies by one.

Supplies Available: [0]

Use Repairkit on target to restore armor.

Each use of a Repairkit reduces supplies by one.

Supplies Available: [0]

Throw grenade at target tile causing area damage.

Throwing grenades reduces supplies by one.

Supplies Available: [0]
Attack a neighbouring target with your fist. Does little damage, but sometimes that's all you need.
Concentrating restores 1 bravery point for this character.
Shoot a healing projectile at an ally. Restores 20% HP for 3 turns. Does not require or consume supplies.
A powerful attack tripling damage done to the enemy's armor.
The target ally will receive a morale boost giving them +5 agility this turn.
A crippling attack causing the target to lose 75% movement range for 2 turns.
Revive a downed ally and restore 10 HP. Does not require or consume supplies.
During the next turn this character will perform a counter attack on the first enemy attacking them.
When attacked in close range this character will perform a sudden strike before the enemy's attack.
Move to an adjacent position up to 2 tiles away. Dash doesn't trigger ambushes. Does not use any action points but does cost 1 bravery point.
Attack enemy with a Quantum Leech that turns 50% of Body Damage into health for the attacker.
Attack up to 3 targets right in front of you. Damage is reduced by 20%.
If attack is successful, the target will be killed instantly. You may only target already injured enemies with this ability.
Restore 25% of target's HP. Also removes any negative status effects. Does not require or consume supplies.
Warning Shots let you place a conical area to observe during the next turn. Any enemy moving in this area will receive a warning shot stopping their movement. Warning shots will not deal any damage.

The character vanishes out of sight and is invisible to enemies for the next turn. Vanished characters can move unseen. If this character attacks an enemy, however, the vanish effect will be neutralised.
Use your psychic powers to force an enemy to attack one of their allies. The ally is selected randomly.
A mighty fist punch pushing your enemy back 2 tiles. May cause additional damage if the pushed back target hits a wall or other units.
Throw a bait that attracts dogs and zombies in the effect area for one turn.
Allows use of First Aid ability.
Allows use of Psychic Control ability.
This character is KO. You may revive them by using a medkit.
Determines the amount of experience points a character receives. The higher the intelligence the quicker a character will level up.
Determines how far a character can move per turn.
If a character is knocked out, endurance determines how many turns a character stays alive.
Higher dexterity means your character has a better aim and improved hit probabilities.
Determines the number of bravery points. Bravery points are used to execute special abilities.
Determines your evade chance. Every attack against your character has a small chance of evading.
Leonora De Quincey, British Amateur Archeologist
Flexible supporter, capable with assault rifles
Starts with Shredding Shot special ability
Monsignor Carlo Veduti, Italian Vatican Legate
Brunhilda, Queen of the Valkyries, Icelandic Fairground Wrestler
Starts with Sucker Punch special ability
Captain Luiz 'Piranha' Pereira, Brazilian Steamboat Smuggler
Agent Georgette Remy, Belgian Secret Agent
Starts with Reaction Shot special ability
Starts with Psychic Control special ability
Agile melee fighter, strong vs. undead
Starts with Sudden Strike special ability
Baron von B., German Gentleman Imposter
Starts with Crippling Shot special ability
Rose Sheffield, American Adventuress and Mystic
Starts with Healing Shot special ability
Miguel Ignacio Caballero, Spanish Civil War Poet
Robust grenade expert, strong vs. Nazis
Starts with Warning Shots special ability
Prince Omar Abu al-Jarabi, Arabian Art Collector
Starts with First Aid special ability
Annabelle Césaire Montserrat, Caribbean Freelance Aviatrix

Casablanca, Morocco: 
You receive a desperate plea for help – your old friend Morten has been abducted by the Nazis and taken to the Moroccan desert!
You decide to travel to North Africa immediately to find Morten before the Germans execute him!

You take a break in a provincial backwater, a few miles beyond Casablanca. This is the last outpost of civilization – beyond this point is nothing but merciless desert. Morten is out there somewhere...
Chattering excitedly, you stroll back to your jeep. You get in and drive into the setting sun while Morten entertains you with his absurd anecdotes.

Jerusalem, Palestine:
Morten was quite right: The Nazis are up to something sinister…
That's why you are hot on the heels of a German expedition to Mount Ararat. They are searching for a mysterious object known as the Wrath of God. 
Foil their plans!
Your vantage point on the hill provides an excellent view of the heights and valleys of Palestine. A large cloud of dust on the dirt track below marks out a large German convoy.
The Wrath of God! The artifact should be buried forever under tons of rock - your only consolation is that the Nazis will never get their hands on it...

Cairo, Egypt:
The wild rumours circulating among local occultists over the past few weeks lead you to one terrifying conclusion:
The unholy cultists of the Khonesh Brotherhood plan to reawaken Turash-Ra, the Black Pharaoh! 
You travel to the stone desert of Meroe to stop them!

You leave the hustle and noise of Cairo behind you; before you stretch the lazy bends of the Nile, lifeline of ancient Egypt. The mighty river disappears into the eternal expanse of the Egyptian desert.
Your engine roars as you leave the pyramid behind forever! Turash-Ra will never see the light of day again...

Port Said, Egypt:
A Nazi expedition has joined forces with the Brotherhood! They are planning an unholy ritual on Mount Sinai. Who knows what evil they intend to summon? You fear the worst!
Why are the Germans working with the Brotherhood? What are they planning on Mount Sinai? Will you be able to thwart their plans?
Confused, you prepare to head back down. Maybe not every riddle needs to be solved...

Jeddah, Arabia:
With his dying breath, the old caravan guide swore that he had seen Kharga Serabit with his own eyes. Kharga Serabit, swallowed by the desert sands so many millennia ago!
The very next day, you set off on a journey that leads you deep into the heart of the merciless desert!

The dusty desert path leads you out of Jeddah, away from the lush greenery of its walled gardens and the turquoise waves of the Red Sea that break against the gleaming white quay walls of the proud harbor city.
Gritting your teeth, you turn your back on this cursed place forever to set out on your long journey to the coast...

Djibouti, East Africa:
The cultists of the Khonesh Brotherhood are searching the Abyssinian Highlands for the final resting place of the Queen of Sheba. According to legend, her temple grave is the repository of the Divine Chariot, Merkabah. 
You must stop them!
You sigh with relief as your dilapidated sailboat approaches the massive harbor walls of Djibouti: Dry land under your feet again at last!
Sighing, you start your journey back - all the richer for this mysterious experience...
Moves require an additional press to confirm.

Whenever you see this notification blinking you can click on this button to see more information on the current context.

You can disable this in the options screen.

Use L/R to cycle through available adventures. 

As you progress through the game, you will unlock new adventures to play. For now, you only have one adventure to choose from.
 
Throughout the game, tutorial pop-ups like this one will introduce core gameplay elements. You can disable these at any time in the Options menu. 

Extensive gameplay information is always available in the in-game Codex.
Return last item from the valuables bag back to your inventory.
This choice may yield a positive or negative outcome.
This option uses a character perk. It generally yields a positive outcome but in some instances may result in unexpected situations.
This option uses a character perk. Your team does not possess the appropriate perk.
This topic is locked because you have not yet encountered the enemies described.

Speed up the AI turn.

You may change the default speed in the game options.
Learn more about this in the Codex...
Click anywhere outside the tooltip to continue.
Press any button to dismiss tutorial.
Double click on three characters to assemble your expedition.

Before you can begin an adventure, you must assemble a Team of three characters.
 
Use L/R to cycle through the available characters.
Press Recruit to add a character to your Team.

Equip your characters with items from the car storage if you have already collected any.

Increase the upper limit of your travel resources and car storage as soon as you have enough money.

After every adventure, you can equip your characters with items you've collected from previous adventures. Press Y to toggle between the character overview and your car storage.

You can also increase the upper limit of your travel resources and car storage capacity as soon as you have enough money.
Get to the destination on the other side of the map to complete the adventure.

Left click on a green location: Travel to location. 

The journey there consumes one fuel.

Rotate the Left Stick to browse nearby locations on the map. Press A to travel.

Traveling to an adjacent location consumes 1 x Fuel.
Left click on the bar at the bottom of the screen: Open the team screen. (Alternatively: Press I)

Press Y to access the Journal. 
- The Team page lets you manage items and skills. 
- The Codex page lets you review tutorial info and learn more about the world. 
- The Trophies page lists your achievements.

Select character: Left-click on the character portrait.

Equip character: Drag an item from the car storage to the equipment slots of a character qualified to use it.

Heal character: Left click on medkit, select target character.

The Team page lets you equip items, manage your inventory, and customize character skills.

Navigation: 
Use L/R to cycle through Team members. 
Use Left Stick to browse equipment and storage.

Equip / Use items:
Press A to see all available actions for the currently selected item.
Most items can be equipped. Some items, such as medkits, will let you heal outside of combat.
Decisions with consequences that vary for the better or the worse, are indicated as gamble decisions.
Left click to open the loot boxes and click on your loot to take it with you – either individually or by clicking on the Take All button below.

Loot obtained from an event is displayed at the top of the screen, above your car storage.

To take a piece of Loot individually, navigate with Left Stick and select with A. Alternatively, you can use the Take All button.

Right-click on the bag with your valuables: Sell. 

Right-click on one of your items: Sell. 

Click on one of the trader’s items: Purchase.

Use Left Stick to browse the Trader menu.

Press A to buy items from the Trader's inventory and to sell items from your car storage.

Sell Valuables with the Sell Valuables button.

Left click on the bar at the bottom of the screen: Open the team screen. (Alternatively: Press I)

Left click the Level Up button above the character portrait: Open the skill tree

Once a character gains enough experience points, you can choose to increase their Level. This will improve their stats and unlock new skills.

To increase a character's Level, open the Journal and select that character from the Team page. Press Level Up to open the Level Up menu.

Each time you level up, you can choose a new advantage for your character.

In the skill tree, left click the desired advantage and confirm your choice.

When characters level up, they can learn new Skills.

In the Skill Tree, use Left Stick to browse Skills, and press A to choose one. Select Confirm Changes to finalize your choice.
Click on the green starting tiles to place your characters.

Choose the starting locations for each of your characters.

Use Left Stick to navigate the starting area. 
Use L/R to cycle between available characters.
Press A to place the currently selected character.

A unit is in cover protection as soon as it is directly horizontally or vertically adjacent to a piece of cover.

Diagonal adjacency does not provide cover.
Each character may perform a maximum of two actions per turn: a maximum of one attack action and one movement action, or up to two neutral actions.

Some actions are special actions and require bravery points.

Successful attacks or healing of allied characters will regenerate bravery points during combat.

When planning your movement to a new position, press Tab to see what enemies can be attacked at what hit probability. This will also indicate enemies out of range or sight. 

Move your cursor over an enemy to see their attack range (red). Then press Tab to see their movement range (blue).

When you attack an enemy, the tooltip above the enemy displays the expected damage and hit probability. Press Tab for more details.

In certain situations, the X button can reveal more details about how your character engages with the enemy.

While moving a character: Hold X to see the probability of hitting an enemy from the current location. This will also indicate whether an enemy is out of attack range or out of the selected character's sight.

When attacking an enemy: Hold X to see more information about damage calculation.

Enemy armor reduces their damage. Each hit reduces the armor protection, however.

Some types of damage are impeded more or less by armor than others.
Blindsided: In your first turn, you can only EITHER move OR perform an action before the enemy attacks!
Tumult: The enemy moves after you have placed your characters. Only then can you start your turn.
Advantage: You start the battle with your own turn before the enemy can react.

The number over the head of an unconscious character indicates the number of turns until they perish.

Move a character with the ability to heal next to the unconscious character and bring back your friend!

Much has changed in Pathway and there’s a whole host of new features. You may notice that we've had to reset your characters skill trees and some of your items have been updated. 

Whilst you can continue on your previous adventure, we recommend creating a new profile to get the most out of your Pathway experience.

Hardcore Mode follows different rules than standard Pathway: All adventures play in a sequence one after the other. Everything carries over to the next adventure and you have to survive with only the things you find during your travels. Some additional changes:

- Failing/Winning will lock the profile.
- All jeep upgrades and characters are unlocked from the start.
- Permadeath: When a character dies, they are dead for good.
- No achievements
- Higher base difficulty

We highly recommend to only try this mode after spending some time exploring the standard game.

Pathway has received a new Hardcore Mode! It is a fresh and challenging new way to play the game. 

In order to play in Hardcore Mode you have to create a new profile with the Hardcore Mode checkmark selected.
One random positive and negative perk have been removed.
Hardcore Mode does not allow restarting of an adventure.
